dialogue.text: I got an idea but what's the story?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm going to ask her to marry me.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well that's only your business, Chris.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No it's not only my business.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What do you want me to do; you're old enough to know your own mind.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So it's all right then I'll go ahead with it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, you want to make sure that your father isn't-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: See it isn't just my business-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm just saying

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Sometimes you infuriate me you know that. Isn't it your business to if I tell dad and he throws a fit about it? You have such a talent for ignoring things.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I ignore what I got to ignore. The girl is Larry's girl.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: She's not Larry's girl.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: From father's point of you he isn't dead and you have no right to take his girl.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You can go on from there if you know where to go but I don't know where to go, see I don't know. So what can I do for you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know why but every time I reach out for something that I really want, I have to pull back 'cause someone else will suffer. My whole bloody life, time after time after time.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're a considerate fellow.  There's nothing wrong with that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: To hell with that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Have you asked Annie yet?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I wanted to get this settled first.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: How do you know she'll marry you? Maybe she feels the same way your father does.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, if she does then that's the end of it. From her letters I think she's forgotten him.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know, I'll find out. Then we'll trash it out with dad, right? Mom, don't avoid me.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Trouble is you don't see enough women, you never did.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So what I'm not fast with women.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I just don't see why it has to be Annie.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Because it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That's a good answer but it doesn't answer anything. I mean you haven't seen her since you went away to war it's five years.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I can't help it I know her best. I mean lived next door to her my whole life. These years when I think of a wife, I think of Annie.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What do you want, a diagram?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't want a diagram. He thinks he's coming back. Chris, you marry this girl you're pronouncing him dead.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do you know what's going to happen to your father because I don't, see?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All right. All right. Mom.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just give it some more thought.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I've given it three years of thought. I thought that if I waited, dad would forget about Larry and we could have a regular wedding and everything happy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: If I can't do that here well, then I'll have to get out.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What the hell is this?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'll get out. I'll get married and go live some place else, maybe New York.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What the hell is this, are you crazy?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I've been a good son too long a good sucker, I'm through with it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What about the business? What is this?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: The business?  The business doesn't inspire me.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Must you be inspired?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, I like it and hour a day. If I'm going to grub for money all day long, at least in the evening I want it beautiful.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I want a family; I want kids; I want something I can give myself to. Annie is in the middle of that. Now where do I find it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Tell me, you'd leave the business?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, on this I would.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, you don't want to think like that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Then help me stay here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: All right. But you don't want to be thinking like that 'cause otherwise what did we work for, I mean the whole thing is for you, Chris, the whole shooting match is for you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know I know mom. All right. Just help me stay here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just don't go thinking that way.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, I am thinking that way.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't understand you, do I?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, you don't. I'm a pretty tough guy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yea, I can see that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Uhm, I don't know

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: So how you feeling?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know what I'm going to do about this; I mean

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I have got to get a job, you know? Like-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You've been doing a lot of work for it, right?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, yea you know, I get my resumes and I mean I-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Right, so the fact you doing the best that you can is -

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I go out all the places I can, every place that'll give an interview you know.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: you know you shouldn't give yourself a hard time for that, it's the best you can.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But it's been so long, like what - what am I - what am I waiting -- I should probably just do something else, or

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, but you care about what you do, right?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know, I mean why - why

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yea, but it's - it's almost like it's not worth it you know, if I'm going to waste to have my life like trying to get a job, I mean once I actually do get the job it's like oh, retirement or something. I don't know, you know.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I understand that it's so frustrating but I know that you're here because you really want it you know and, and uh

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, and that's what I begin to question after a while is maybe I just don't want it, maybe it's not even worth it, you know, like

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't even know if it's going to be worth it because I can't break myself in, you know like I can't - can't even get a foot in the door you know.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I mean you're still here you've tried for this long so I think that says something all in itself.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yea, it says I'm stupid enough to be trying this long and not move on somewhere else.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You are persistence. I mean that's important. that's

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, I can't- I can't be persistent forever, you know, you can't not have a job forever, you know, I've got- I've got to do something, I've got to make money and get food on the table.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, you're talented so keep that in mind, you know, you shouldn't give yourself too hard of a time.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, maybe I'm not, you know. I don't have a job. Maybe - maybe I'm not as good as-as I thought I was and

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I just got a whole skewed opinion on just how this is supposed to work out and

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know, it's just not, I don't know - I don't know what to do really, you know, I'm just thinking

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: maybe - maybe take up painting, I don't know, you know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Do something that I don't have to go out and do something, stay at home, I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Seems like the only option at this point because obviously the outer world has just rejected me of all possible employment.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That's- I mean. There are more factors then just whether you're good or not, you know what I mean like

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: and the fact that you know there is always different types of things and what kind of people they want in the office and whether it's male or female or you know what I mean, like things are out of your control.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: So you should take that in consideration rather than giving yourself such a hard time.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know, but I mean- if that's the - you know, I'm either like the worst at this or just the most unlucky person on the planet I mean this doesn't

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It might be the latter I don't know because you're not the worst, I mean you're great, you very talented at what you do.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: this doesn't happen to a normal person.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You know and the fact you still here and still cooking, like it's good that you're thinking about it, that you're reconsidering.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But like, just because you're considering why it's been so difficult doesn't mean you should just stop.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, I don't know, I don't see - I don't see any other way - any other way around it right now.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Maybe you should take a little break from it, but I don't think you should stop.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What am I going to do on a break?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Get out of town or something, I mean you need - you need to clear your head 'cause you seem like you're really frustrated about it. I mean you need to like, be excited about you're doing, rather than, you know upset.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Right. Thanks for talking to me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, you're never going to believe it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What? What? You look really happy what's going on?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, I finally did it

dialogue.text: Finally did what?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I-I asked her to marry me.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You did? Oh, my Gosh, I'm so proud of you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, I know. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, my Gosh. Well, and did

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm so nervous you know, I'm-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Did she say yes?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, she said yes. [LAUGHTER] I know

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That's like the most definitive.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know Uhm- I can't believe it.  It's like-

dialogue.text: Oh, my gosh, wait so when did you decide to do this, I mean,

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I would have thought you would have told me that you were planning on doing this.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, yes, I wanted it you know I guess sort of as a surprise for everyone so

dialogue.text: Yea, I guess so. Oh, my Gosh. Was she surprised?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, yes. You know, she - she was like - I mean, she was happy, you know

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I - I think it was about time, I don't know, maybe. You know what, it's been it's been long enough now.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: So what did you do?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, well, it was -- you know, we were at this- at this concert and yeah

dialogue.text: so I-I talked to some of the crew before hand and-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, You did not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I-I did.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, my Gosh. that's so cute

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So I got the band to do something, you know, like towards the end of the song I got to go up on stage and, uh

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That's so romantic. Oh, my Gosh. She must have died. That's like one of those things you write into a magazine about like my boyfriend did this. Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know, so

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I got to freak her out.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, yes -- so

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: She must have flipped out.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yea, that way she was guaranteed that she could not say no.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Right exactly because you can't say no in front of thousands of people. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, but it was good.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Did you bring her up on stage too?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, yes. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, my Gosh, that's so cute.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know it was, I don't know I was really nervous but I'm really - I'm really glad.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Are your parents excited or...?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh yes, they - they you know they love her and so I mean...

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yea, totally. So when is it going to happen?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, we're thinking uh - we're thinking winter time, you know, we're going to do it in the winter and then maybe, you know, maybe

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know either do a honeymoon like in the snow or fly down to like Australia, Southern Hemisphere, [GARBAGE] so we'll decide with that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Ooh, that would be fun.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do you think you'll get a house or something, like you guys are looking to buy some place or

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yea, yea, I'm not too sure where yet I guess you know, I kind of got to figure some stuff out here first

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: but like you know it's just - I guess we're just excited right now that we'll get to continue it together.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh my Gosh. I cannot believe you're getting married, that is so cool.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Golly, it just makes me all like romantic inside, like I really want that to happen to me. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, it will, obviously you know. But I know it's something - I don't know, you never really think about it happening, like before hand.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Did you have a good ring? You better have had a good ring.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Sure. Oh, yes.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Good. The ring makes all the difference.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You know I had my mom come along maybe help me out a little bit because she's got good taste. but

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, that's awesome.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, well, Thanks, thanks. Thank you. yeah

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yay, well congratulations, that's so cool. [BREATHING] I can't wait.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Hah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Good God.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do you think it's them?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I wonder.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, nobody know we're here except Freda and she wouldn't ring up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Must be them, then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What're we gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We're all right, darling, aren't we?  Whatever happens.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Now and always, sweet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't care then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It was bound to come sooner or later.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Hello?  Hello?  What?  Wrong number.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Ah, it send shivers up my spine.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: With the most perfect poise?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, of course.  I shall probably do a court curtsy.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What's so horrible is that one can't stay happy.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's true.  The whole business is a very poor joke.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Meaning that sacred and beautiful thing, love?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, meaning just that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, what does it all mean?  That's what I ask myself in my ceaseless quest for ultimate truth.  Dear God, what does it all mean?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't laugh at me.  I'm serious.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You mustn't be serious, my dear one.  That's just what they want.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Who's they?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All those futile moralists that try to make life unbearable.  Laugh at them.  Be flippant.  Laugh at everything.  All their sacred shibboleths.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Flippancy brings out the acid in their damn sweetness and light.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: If I laugh at everything, then I must laugh at us too.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Certainly, you must.  We're figures of fun, alright.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well how long will it last us, this ludicrous overbearing love of ours.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Who knows.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, shall we always want to bicker and fight?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, that desire will fade.  Along with our passion.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, dear, shall we like that?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Depends on how well we've played.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, what happens if one of us dies?  I mean, does the one that's left still laugh?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes.  Yes. With all his might.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That's serious enough, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No. No, it isn't.  Death is very laughable.  Such a cunning little mystery.  All done with mirrors.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Darling, I believe you're talking nonsense.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So is everyone else in the long run.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Let's be superficial and pity the poor philosophers.  Let's blow our trumpets and squeakers and enjoy the party as much as we can.  Like quite idiotic, very small school children.  Let's savor the delight of the moment.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Come and kiss me, darling, before your body rots and worms pop in and out of your eye sockets.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Elliott, worms don't pop.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't care what you do.  See, you could paint yourself green and dance naked in the Place Vendome and rush off madly with all the men in the world and I shan't say a word.  As long as you love me best.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you, dear.  The same applies to you except that if I catch so much as looking at another woman, I'll kill you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You remember that awful scene we had in Venice?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Which particular one?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: The one when you bought that little painted wooden snake in the Piazza and put it on my bed.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Charles.  That was his name.  Charles.  He did wriggle so beautifully.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ah, horrible thing.  I hated it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, I know you did.  You threw it out of the window into the Grand Canal.  I don't think I'll ever forgive you for that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: How long did that row last?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It went in intermittently for days.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: The worst one was in Cannes when your curling iron burnt a hole in my new dressing gown.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It burned my comb too and all the towels in the bathroom.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That was a rouser, wasn't it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That was the first time you ever hit me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I didn't hit you very hard.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: The manager came in and found us rolling around on the floor, biting and scratching like panthers.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, I'll never forget his face.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It was ridiculous.  Completely ridiculous.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We were very much younger then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And very much sillier.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: [BREATHING] So, you know I've been hearing back from some colleges.

dialogue.text: Oh, yeah? Have you gotten letters yet?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah. And guess who accepted me?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Um, I don't know, where?

dialogue.text: Oh, U.S.C.? Oh my Gosh, that's awesome, that was your top choice, right?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh my Gosh, that's so cool.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, oh. I - You have no-

dialogue.text: God, I-I got this big packet you know, in the mail and it's like-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: yes, this is [LAUGHTER], it says U.S.C., like registrar, I mean like, I got-I got some like little letters before you know, it's like oh rejection

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: [LAUGHTER] It's gotta be it, like-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh my Gosh, that's so cool.

dialogue.text: but big packet, big packet is nice

dialogue.text: big packet is gotta be the real thing. yeah

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So it's like, yes, rip it open and there it is big - oh, yes.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh my Gosh. I thought there was like, maybe going to be some, like I don't know if you are going to get in or not, so I'm really glad that you did.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That's so cool.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah. I know, I know.

dialogue.text: I know, I know, yea. It'll be interesting you know, I've never -- I mean getting out of Vegas and everything but LA

dialogue.text: This entire time you're fighting with me sir, you could've finished the form and already been half way-- No.  Get out.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I did finish one.  Take it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So what do you think?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: About what?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: About what I was just saying.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's ridiculous.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It certainly is not. It is slightly exaggerated scientific fact.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's so P.R. I mean, somebody's giving you a good bill about this wonderful event that's going to happen on the beach.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, I'm not the only one. Look at all these people.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Exactly. Everyone else is told the same thing. It keeps them feeling excited. Keeps them coming back. Keeps them thinking life's going to start at any minute now.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Are we talking about the same thing?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't care. It's still fish to me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Carla, can I ask you something? Don't take this wrong, but are you having your period?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Augie, Goddamn it, don't ask me that. You always ask me that. Why do you ask me that? I hate it. It's insulting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay, then what's bugging you?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look, it's-we just-we're looking at this evening in a different way, both of us. We both have different ideas of it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There's nothing to it, alright? We come down here, the grunion arrive, they do their little fish business, we go ooh, ah, look at the fish, and then they go home and we go home.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's not like that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We're not seeing the grunions?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look, Augie, we've never seen them. They're never going to come.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We missed them twice. That's not ever.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Twice is as many times as we've tried. That's ever.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We'll see them this time.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, we won't.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's impossible. It's like waiting around. Waiting to see Santa Claus, you know?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Like I feel like my whole life I've been just standing on this beach with my hands clasped waiting for these fish to show up and these fish never show up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: God, I thought you wanted to see it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I do.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look, I did. I always do. But it's like every time I try nothing ever happens.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's just fish. Nothing to get traumatized over.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: For God's sake, Augie, this is not about fish.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I've been turning this thing over in my head trying to figure out when the point was when we took a turn for the worse, and I can't seem to pinpoint it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You were fine during the phone call from Marge. Dinner was okay. Doing the dishes was no problem. Let's see. I took a shower. You were watching the news. You said Augie, I think the grunion are running. I said great, let's go. I feel lucky tonight.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And so I'm getting the animals, putting the animals out in the yard. I'm putting on my jacket, getting the car out of the garage-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do you remember the last time we came here?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We thought I was pregnant.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You brought a bottle of champagne.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We took off our shoes and we danced barefoot in the sand. Under the moon.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And you whispered so intimately in my ear so I could feel your words.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, that moment-that was it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I told myself finally, this is how happy I'm supposed to be.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Wait a minute. I got it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Dancing barefoot in the sand. Drinking out of a bottle of champagne.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It was driving past the Knickerbocker Liquor Locker, right? You said let's get some champagne, and I said time's-a-wasting or something like that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You want this to be like the other time, right? That's it. Right?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't want to remember something.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Hope for some things.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Right. I got it. Of course. Listen, do you want to dance?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Do you want me to get some champagne?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Take off our shoes?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, no.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What? What? Do you want me to breathe in your ear?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Do you want to get married again? What? What? Do you want to get a divorce?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: A vacation?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: A new carpet? A poodle?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: A-a back rub, some ice cream, a suicide pact. What the hell do you want, Carla?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I want things to turn out the way that they're supposed to be.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Jesus, welcome to the human race.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Did you think this is how I thought it was going to turn out? Do you think I had some great fantasy down the line? That four years down the line that we'd come to the beach and argue with each other over fish?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, I was just like you. I thought it was going to be all peaches and roses and everything great. And the wind in our hair and the sand in our toes, and the fish will always come and the bills will pay themselves, and we'll have three big fat rosy kids. And oh God.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You know what you get? The jokes on us, baby. Because do you know what you get? Huh? Carla? Do you know what you get? You get this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This what? What is this? This is nothing.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, it's not. It's standing on the beach waiting and fighting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Things have never turned out anything the way that I thought they would be.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, I know. Me neither.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I mean, this is, this is everything, and it's a lot, but

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: it's not something else. Do you know what I'm trying to say?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, I'm doing the best I can.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know you are, Augie, and I know you wanted this evening to be nice, but I can't help thinking of being somewhere else.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, maybe if you were with someone else too.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I didn't say that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, I know. But I know I don't make you happy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Augie, anything I do I'd rather be doing with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: God, don't you know that? I mean, you're the one that probably wants to be with somebody else. Somebody that didn't take herself so seriously, could enjoy herself more.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Actually now that you mention it, no, I don't.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I guess we're just in the wrong spart-spot with the right person.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Seemed like a pretty good spot to me. I mean, look at the view of the moon we've got from here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I noticed that. It's beautiful.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You can see right over the water.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: God, big old white moon.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Look what we got here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You brought refreshments?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's not champagne.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: At least we won't need glasses.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Are you still cold? Do you want to go home?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: So I was thinking you might be right.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Maybe this is the right place after all.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Augie.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Shh.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: If we're very quiet the fish might come.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Or not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Or not.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're the only one I know that still loves his parents.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know.  It sort of went out of style didn't it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.  It's alright.  It's a good thing, you know?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's lovely here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: The air is so sweet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're not sorry you came?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.  I'm not sorry.  But I'm not going to stay.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: First of all your mother so much as told me to go.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well...

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look,

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: you saw the way that she acted and then well, I mean, you, you were acting kind of...

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I don't know, embarrassed of her since I came.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well the trouble is I was planning on sneaking up on you over a week or so and they take it for granted that we're all set.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah.  I know they would, especially your mother.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: How did you know?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well what other reason, from her point of view, would I be coming here?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So, would you want to?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, that's the reason why I asked you here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well,

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh Annie.  I love you.  I love you a great deal.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I love you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I guess that's why I came.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't...I have no imagination that's the only way I know how to tell it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm embarrassing you.  I didn't want to tell you this here.  I wanted to drive someplace brand new where we'd be brand new to each other.  It feels wrong here don't you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: This yard and this chair.  I don't want to win you from anything, I want you to be ready for me.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look, I've been ready for a long, long time now.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Then he's gone forever, you sure?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look, I almost got married two years ago.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why didn't you?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You started to write me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You felt something that far back.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Every day since.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why didn't you let me know?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I was waiting for you Chris, I mean, till then you never wrote and then when you did what did you say?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You'd always be so ambiguous.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Give me a kiss Ann, just give me...

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh God.  Annie, I kissed Annie.  I kissed Annie.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'll never forgive you for that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: How long, how long I've been waiting to do that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I mean,  Why did you wait all these years?  There I was sitting around and wondering if I was crazy for thinking about you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We're going to live now.  I'm going to make you so happy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Not like that you're not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I kissed you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Like Larry's brother.  Do it like you Chris.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Nothing.  Hey, let's drive somewhere.  I want to be alone with you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, what is it?  Your mother?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, nothing, nothing like that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Tell me what's wrong.  I mean, even in your letters you seemed ashamed.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, yes I guess I've been ashamed but, it's going from me.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You got to tell me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know where to start.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay.  It wouldn't work like this?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You remember overseas I was in command of a company?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well I lost them.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: How many?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Just about all.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Geez.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Takes a little while to toss that off cause they weren't just men.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: For instance, one time this...it had been raining several days and this one kid, he came up to me, he gave me his last pair of dry socks, put them in my pocket.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That's just a little thing but that's the kind of guys I had.  They didn't just die, they killed themselves for each other and I mean that exactly.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: A little more selfish and they'd still be here today.  And I got this idea watching them go down.  See everything was being destroyed but there was one new thing that was being created.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It was a kind of responsibility, man for man.  You understand me?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And to show that and to bring that onto the earth again like some sort of monument standing right behind all of us and we could feel it and it would make a difference to him.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And then I came here and it was incredible.  There was no meaning in it here.  The whole thing to them was a kind of bus accident.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I went to work with dad and that rat race again and I felt what you said, ashamed.  Somehow because nobody was changed at all.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It seemed to make a sucker out of a lot of guys.  I felt wrong to be alive.  I felt wrong to have that new checkbook,

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: open that new bank account, drive the new car and see the new refrigerator

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: cause you can take those things out of the war.  But you got to know, when you drive that car that it came out of the love that a man can have for a man and you got to be a little bit better because of that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Otherwise what you have is loot and there's blood on it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I didn't want to take any of it and I guess that included you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And you still feel that way?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I want you now Annie.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Cause you must not feel that way again.  You hear me?  You can't.  You deserve everything you have Chris.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: that includes me too, I mean and the money, you have right to that money.  Your father put planes up in the air, good planes and he deserves it, you should be proud of that.  A man should be paid for that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: [GARBAGE] Annie

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Annie I'm going to make a fortune for you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What am I going to do with a fortune?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Buy some hats?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: God, finally I got to the line, the front of the line. I've been waiting there for like half an hour.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: [BREATHING] It's so hot in here. Hoo.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, um-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What's wrong?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You didn't fill this out right. All right. It says that you have to fill out the back sheet of this, but you filled out the yellow sheet of it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, no, no, no, no, no. The lady over there, she told me to fill out the front and she said to wait in this line.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Who?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't know. Some lady. Sonya or something.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: She- she probably doesn't even work here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Excuse me? No, no. I waited in the line over there..

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All right  Uh-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: and she told me to come over here and she said to fill out everything on the application and I did that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's not right.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look, I-- No, no, no, I--you don't understand. I have to go back to work.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You just take--all right.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, you didn't fill this paper at work out right and it's going to take another fifteen minutes to do it and look at how long the line we got here so just-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I am not-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: okay, just go back and fill it out real quick and I'm sorry, you have to get back in line and wait. I can't let you cut.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But you don't understand. I cannot get back in line because I have to go back to work. I will get fired if I don't leave here.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, maybe you should have got here earlier than so you had a lot of time to do this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But I was at work and the lady told me to come and work it and to stand in the line.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know who this lady is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: How's it going, babe?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Good.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Hey listen,eh- I've been wanting to talk to you. I have something to tell you. How's Amy doing?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: She's doing fine. She just took her first steps today actually. I videotaped it for you so you can watch it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: yeah.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: oh.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I really want to say that. Well I, so, you know, at the center department they called me in and I talked to-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah? What did they say?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well umm- actually they--I was promoted.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, wow. That's great.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And Uh- Yeah. Uh- They're going to need um- more nurses on call for uh- to go overseas to help out with the war.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And uh - seeing as I was uh- promoted and head of the department now, and so- well, they asked me to go.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: when?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's going- It's going to be probably in about three weeks.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What? You can't do that. Three weeks?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: yeah

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I'm leaving in three weeks, but-- Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: God, we're supposed to take a look at a house next week.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Maybe we can still do that

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I can't- No, I can't do this alone.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, and uh--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Amy's starting school in a month.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know, but look, I have to take this. I mean, if I don't, I mean, I could get fired.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And we know you need-we need the money. We couldn't even- purchase a house if I didn't take this.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: God.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You know what happened to my cousin. She went and she never came back.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Honey, I'm going to come back. It's not like that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But it- it is for a year.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Babe, I'm sorry. But I don't want to do.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I can't-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You know as much as -as much as me that I-I want to stay here with you and Amy so bad, but I can't.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You remember the last time you went? You know how hard it was for me? Now we have a kid.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But you're so good with her. You know, she knows you better than she knows me 'cause I'm at work every day.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I have to work.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: [BREATHING]

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Babe, I love you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You can't leave your daughter alone like this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But she has you. I mean, that's what you're there for. You're my right-hand man.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's going to be okay.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You can't postpone it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, I have to go.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Wait, you can write me and as you know, send me pictures.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know if I can handle you going another year.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know if I- if I could take it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look, I need you to be strong for me. 'Cause I can't be the only one that's strong right now, really, I--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I can't be that strong. A whole year.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: me, oh my god.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But we can work, you know, we--you can write me and we could see pictures

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What if you don't come back?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: and if we survive, if we survive that then babe, you know you know we could survive any--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I will come back.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What am I supposed--oh, one out of five people aren't coming back.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It doesn't look very good.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I can do it. I'm going to do it. And I'll be back safe and sound and-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: we'll have all the money that we ever needed.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And- And then I'll stop working and- I'll stay home with the baby.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't want the money. I want-you here

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.text: Okay.  And your name is?

dialogue.text: Olivia.

dialogue.text: okay.

dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.text: Line?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's become a habit with you.

dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, just making myself fascinating for you

dialogue.text: Oh.  That reply has broken my heart.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: The woman's job is to allure the man.  Watch me a minute, will you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, no, it isn't.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, be quiet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Line?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's a pity you didn't- It's a pity you didn't have more brandy.

dialogue.text: It's a pity you didn't have any more brandy.  It might have made you a little less disagreeable.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It doesn't seem to have worked such wonders with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Line?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Snap.  Oh, snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.

dialogue.text: Adders don't snap, they sting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: They -- nonsense, they have a little bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: They sting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: They snap.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't care.  Do you understand?  I don't care.  I don't mind if they bark and roll about like hoops.

dialogue.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, I did, quite a lot.

dialogue.text: I suppose you let him kiss you a good deal more then, hmm?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Mind your own business.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You must have had a riotous time.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No restraint at all, very enjoyable.  You never had much anyhow.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're quite insufferable.  I expected it's because you're drunk.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm not in the least drunk.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You always had a weak head.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I think I mentioned once before that I've only had three minute liquor glasses of brandy this whole evening.  That's hardly enough to get a child of two drunk.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: On the contrary, a child of two could get violently drunk on only one glass of brandy.

dialogue.text: Very interesting.  And how about a child of four and a child of six and a child of nine?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, shut up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We might get up a splendid little- a splendid little debate about this, you know, intemperate tots.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Not very funny, dear.  You'd better have some more brandy.

dialogue.text: Very good idea.  I will

dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.text: It's late and the people upstairs will get annoyed.

dialogue.text: There are people downstairs, I suppose

dialogue.text: They're away in Tunis.

dialogue.text: This is no time of year for Tunis.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Turn it on again, please.

dialogue.text: I will do no such thing.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Very well, if you insist on being boorish and idiotic.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Turn it off.  It's driving me mad.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Go away.  Go away.  I hate you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Turn it off.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You are far too temperamental.  Try to control yourself.

dialogue.text: We swapped. Listen.

dialogue.text: Listen--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Listen, indeed.  I am sick and tired of listening to you, you damn sadistic bully.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're a vile tempered, loosed living

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Stop.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: wicked little beast. And I- I hope I never see you again as long as live.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Stop.  I hate you.  Do you hear me? You're conceited and overbearing and utterly impossible.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This is the end.  Do you understand, the end?  Finally and forever.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're not going like this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, yes, I am.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, you're not.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Let go of me.  You're a cruel fiend and I hate and loath you.  Thank God, I discovered in time what you're really like.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Shut up. Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're a mean, evil minded

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Marry you again? Huh.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: little vampire And I hope to God I never set eyes on you as long as I live.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Never, never, never.  I'd rather die in torment. Beast brute.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Whore.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Swine.

dialogue.text: Look at this, goose bumps.

dialogue.text: Well so what'd you think?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What I said.

dialogue.text: It's ridiculous.

dialogue.text: Well, I'm sorry, but it's still just fish to me.

dialogue.text: That's not ever.

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We'll see them this year.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, we won't.  It's pointless.  It's like waiting up to see Santa Claus.  I feel as though my entire life is going to be spent standing on the beach with my eyes wide open and my hands clasped expectantly waiting for the fish to show up.  And the fish won't show up.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.text: It was when we were driving passed that knickerbocker liquor locker and you would said, no you said "let's get some champagne" and I said "no time to wasting" or something like that.  That's what it is, right?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You want this to be like the other times, right?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'd rather not remember some things.  I'd rather not hope for some things.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh right sure, of course.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Do you want to dance?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You want me to go get some champagne?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Do you want to take off our shoes?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What? Huh?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You want to get married again?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What?  What?  You want to divorce?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: A vacation?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: A new carpet, a poodle, a suicide pact, ice cream, a back rub, what?  What?  What the hell do you want?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I want something to turn out the way that it's supposed to.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, welcome to the human race.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You think nothing turns out how it's supposed to.  You think I had some grand idea going that four years down the line.  We would come to this beach and argue over fish?  No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You think there would be times when you'd look at me like I was used Kleenex and then I'd look at you and think "Holy hell when is the next flight to Alaska."

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, no I'm just like you, I thought it was going to be all rosy cheeks and the bills would pay themselves and fish will always come and--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No.  You know what you get?  You know what you get?  You get this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This what?  What is this?  This isn't even anything.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, sure this is standing on the beach, this is waiting, fighting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This isn't anything like I thought anything would be.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know me neither.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This is just this.  I mean it includes a lot and everything but it's--do you understand what I'm saying?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm doing the best I can.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know that Augie, I really do.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I just can't help wishing that I was somebody, somewhere else.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Maybe if you were with somebody else too?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I didn't say that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, I know but--I know I don't make you happy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Are you kidding me?  For heaven sake Augie anything I'm doing I'd rather be doing it with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, don't be ridiculous.  Don't you know that?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You are the one who probably wishes he was with somebody else, someone who didn't take everything so seriously, someone who would enjoy yourself.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Actually, you know what?  Now you mentioned that--no I don't.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: So maybe we're in the wrong spot.  But we're with the right person.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know, just seemed like such a good spot to me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We do have really good view of the moon from here though.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh I saw that.  Pretty isn't it. Big ol' white moon.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Look what we got here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Augie, you brought refreshments.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's not champagne.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I guess we don't need glasses.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Are you cold, huh?  Do you want to go home?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm beginning to think you might be right.  I think this might be the spot after all.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Augie, I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Shh...

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: If we are really quiet, the fish might come.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Or not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Or not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Good God.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do you think it's them?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I wonder.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, nobody knows we're here except Freda and she wouldn't ring up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Must be them then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What are we going to do?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We're all right darling, aren't we whatever happens?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Now and always sweet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't care then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's bound to come sooner or later.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Hello? Hello? What? Wrong number.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh. It sends shivers down my spine.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What do we do if they suddenly walk in on us?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Behave exquisitely.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: With the most perfect poise.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, I should probably to a court curtsey.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Things that ought to matter dreadfully don't matter at all when one's is happy, do they?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What's so horrible is that one can't stay happy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh darling don't say that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's true; the whole business is a very poor joke.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Meaning that sacred and beautiful thing love?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes. Meaning just that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What does it all mean that's what I ask- that's what I ask myself in my ceaseless quest for ultimate truth?  Good God what does it all mean?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't laugh at me. I'm serious.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You mustn't be serious my dear one, that's just what they want.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Who's they?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All those futile moralists, who try to make life unbearable, laugh at them, be flippant. Laugh at everything all their sacred shibboleths

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: flippancy brings out the acid in their damned sweetness in light.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, if I laugh at everything then I must laugh at us too.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Certainly you must, we figures of fun all right.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, shall we always want to bicker and fight?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, that desire will fade along with our passion.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh dear, should we like that?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Depends on how well we play it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, what happens if one of us dies, does the one that's left still laugh?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, with all his might.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well that's serious enough, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, no it isn't, death is very laughable, such a cunning little mystery, all done with mirrors.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Darling, I believe you're talking nonsense.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So is everyone else in the long run.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Let's be superficial and pity the poor philosophers, let's blow our trumpets and squeakers and enjoy the party as much as we can. Like quite idiotic, very small, school children. Let's savor the delight of the moment.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Come kiss me darling before your body rots and worms pop in and out of your eye sockets.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Elliot, worms don't pop.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't care what you do see. You can paint yourself green and dance naked in the Place Vendome, and rush off madly with all the men in the world and I shan't say a word, as long as you love me best.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Thank you dear, the same applies you, except that if I catch you so much as looking at another woman, I'll kill you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You remember that awful scene we had in Venice?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Which particular one?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: The one when you bought that little, painted, wooden snake in the Piazza and put it on my bed.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh Charles, that was his name Charles. It did wiggle so beautifully.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Horrible thing, I hated it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know you did. You threw it out of the window into the Grand Canal; I don't think I'll ever forgive you for that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: How long did that row last?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It went on intermittently for days.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: The worst one was in Cannes when your curling iron burned a hole in my new dressing gown.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It burned my comb too and all the towels in the bathroom.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That was a rouser, wasn't it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That was the first time you ever hit me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I didn't hit you very hard.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: The manager came in and found us rolling around on the floor biting and scratching like panthers.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'll never forget his face.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh it was ridiculous, completely ridiculous.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We were very much younger then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And very much sillier.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Hi. Um-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Hi, can I help you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It seems that uh- my-my bag didn't make it out on the carousel.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, did you check? Did you make sure as it went around the second time that it-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, it's gone around like you know twenty times. It's been about a half hour.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay. Well, um- the f.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Actually I'm looking here at the information, the flight that you were on we had some trouble with some of the baggage, it looks like a few peoples' bags didn't make it through. Um, so-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay. So what-what do I have to get you know

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, you can fill out this paperwork um- and if for some reason it shows up, we can bring it to you, but-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: For some reason, so you think it won't show up?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, sometimes it's just late baggage or misplaced baggage and it comes out but it seems to be here and just I'm reading off of this that

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Uh- it didn't make it into the second plane so it looks like there - they don't actually know what happened to it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What? What? How does that happen?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Um, well, sometimes there is just difficulties with loading on to the plane. Uh- There can be a theft or uh- some sort of you know mishap with a cart or something.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I really - I really need that bag.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I- I- I understand, but um.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: there are- I have important things in that bag. I've got

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean -- I've been away for a while and- and now I've- I've gifts for- for you know friends and family I mean, I got stuff in the there

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's worth a lot.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I understand that. Um- So I'm going to put down here that you looking for your baggage, but we actually can't, uh this bag is likely not going to show up so what we're going to do-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Not going to show - well isn't like - wouldn't it just be at the airport, that, like, if it didn't get on the other plane

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: can they check there?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Sometimes it gets stolen, sometimes it gets misplaced on another plane and

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: on another-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: they - they, it gets shipped to somewhere else and then it's stuck somewhere and then we have no way of tracking that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: So we'll- what we'll do

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But we have the tags on. I mean like it wouldn't you know, if it got stuck somewhere it's like well this is nobodies bag I mean maybe you know look on the tag and

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: see where it came from originally. I mean it seems like-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Right. Like I said sometimes a theft and things happen like that but we are willing to reim-reimburse you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Theft?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Um, so.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Theft? Don't you know like all these people that are work - you keep like an eye on them, how can they get away with-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We have very tight security but we -uh- there are times when we just can't uh make sure there aren't absolutely no human error, you know

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry there is no guarantee on baggage.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: This is unbelievable. I've got

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: you don't realize the stuff that I've got in that - I really need to get the suitcase okay

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I understand, so-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: so if it's back there or something, if there is something you can do

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I need you to tell me because I really need to get the bag, okay?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: all right, We've already checked back here for your baggage

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: and we will continue to look for it and because your paper-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You've already checked? Can you check again? [garbage]

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I've already looked, thank you very much and because we've filled out paperwork if it shows up we will send it to you but otherwise what we can do is reimburse you for fifty dollar.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Fifty- fifty dollars? Come on you have got to be joking.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, it's- it's just sort of help with the fact uh that you lost some of your possessions and we rather do that than-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Uh huh, yea, lost some of my possessions, yes, so if I lost maybe a shoe that was in the suitcase and like a carry-on

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: that might be like fifty dollars okay, but this - I- [garbage] I had like thousands of dollars worth of stuff in that suitcase.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: The airline can't afford to give you everything that is in that suitcase. and so-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: The a- what? Talking about a core they can't afford it? I mean-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well because lots of people get their baggage lost and we don't want to have false claims or anything like that so we have

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: we can give you fifty dollar to sort of make up for it, to compensate, and we can definitely let you know if it shows up but likely, more than likely-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean you're not helping me here. What do I have to do here? Do I need to sue the airline company is that what I should do

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: because this is ridiculous?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry. I don't- I-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't believe you should sue the airline company but we do have a policy uh- in which we can reimburse you and that's all we can do and I'm sorry I've done everything I can-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All right. I'm sick- I'm sick of this all right. I'm sick of you and keep your fifty dollar.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: There's other people waiting-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Fine.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's almost time for me to go.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I can't believe that--now--are you sure this is absolutely necessary?  Like--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: There's nothing I can do.  I mean, the government you know--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What--what're we gonna do here?  I can't--I can't do this by myself.  I--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're gonna have to.  I mean, you're a great father.  You can do it.  I know you can.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But, I'm--I'm nothing--I'm nothing without you here.  Maybe we can--we can get out of this somehow.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't think so.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, come on.  You've gotta think of something.  A year--a year away, it's gonna tear us apart.  I don't even--I don't even wanna think about it.  I mean, I don't even know if I'll be able to get in touch with you or--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, we can do the best we can and-and, with um, you know like wireless internet these days--I think that we could-- Talk every once in awhile.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You could send me pictures.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's not going to be the same.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What if--maybe--what if, uh, we went somewhere over there?  I don't--I don't know--I--I need to figure something out for this because--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Their not gonna let you.  You have to stay home and I have to go.  I mean, that's all--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: and--I mean, my daughter--I don't want to put her in danger.  You know?  She has to stay.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: This is gonna be a--a crucial yet--she's--she's growing up.  She's gonna need you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know, but, she needs to be safe more.  She needs to be around kids her age--own age.  She needs to be able to play on the streets and--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But she's--you're not gonna--you're not gonna be here for--for her first words.  For her first steps.  I mean--it's something that you're supposed to be here for that--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You can just remember it for me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know--I don't know--I don't know how--I don't know how this could even be possible for you--I--if I was--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I need--I need you to be able to do this for me 'cause I can't do anything about it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I mean, it's just as hard for me, but--I know that we can do it, you know

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, you just get to--go off and do your thing.  I mean, yeah, we're both--I don't know--it's bad for both of us, but--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: ...it would be so much better if we can--if we could stay together somehow.  You know--we could--we could do this together.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't want you in danger.  And I don't want her in danger.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't want you in danger.  Where are you going?  You're going over to war.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I have no choice. There's nothing I can do.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Honey, you knew there was nothing in that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You took presents from him.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Presents?  Just a trivial little broach.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, I remember it well.  Bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, it wasn't.  It was very pretty.  I still have it and I wear it often.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, I didn't.  You worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You must admit, he was in love with you, wasn't he?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just a little perhaps, nothing serious.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You let him kiss you.  You said you did.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, what of it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What of it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It didn't hurt him at all and I enjoyed it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, what about me?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, if you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey, you never would have known a thing about it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, that's a nice point of view I must say.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm bored with this conversation.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Me, too.  Bored stiff.  You want some brandy?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, thanks.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I think I'll have some.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't see why you want any.  You've already had two glasses.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No particular reason.  Anyhow they were very small ones.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just seems so silly to go on and on and on with such a thing.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You can hardly call three liquor glasses in a whole evening going on and on and on.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, it's become a habit with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You needn't be so grand, just because you don't happen to want any yourself at the moment.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't be so stupid.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Really, Amanda.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Going out somewhere dear?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, just making myself fascinating for you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That reply has broken my heart.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: A woman's job is to allure the man.  Watch me a minute, will you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, it isn't.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, be quiet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ah, it's a pity you didn't have any more brandy.  It might have made you a little less disagreeable.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Doesn't seem to have worked such wonders with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Adders don't snap, they sting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Nonsense.  They have a little bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: They sting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: They snap.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't care, do you understand?  I don't care.  I don't care if they bark or roll about like hoops.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, I did.  Quite a lot.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Hmm, I imagine you let him kiss you a good deal more then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Mind your own business.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, must have had a riotous time. No restraint at all.  Very enjoyable and never had much anyhow.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're quite insufferable

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I expect it's because you're drunk.
